skill.name: bigquery
skill.description: Comprehensive guide for using BigQuery CLI (bq) to query and inspect tables in Monzo's BigQuery projects, with emphasis on data sensitivity and INFORMATION_SCHEMA queries.
skill.summary: Comprehensive guide for using BigQuery CLI (bq) to query and inspect tables in Monzo's BigQuery proj...
skill.author: BfdCampos

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only Markdown guidance. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. Promotes safe data practices with explicit warnings about sensitive data handling.

content.user_title: Query BigQuery tables securely with CLI guidance
content.value_statement: This skill provides safe BigQuery CLI patterns for exploring tables and schemas without accessing sensitive data. It includes INFORMATION_SCHEMA queries, row count checks, and data sensitivity guidelines for responsible data analysis.
actual_capabilities: Inspect table schemas using INFORMATION_SCHEMA queries
Check table row counts safely without exposing data
List tables and find tables by naming patterns
Export column schemas to files for programmatic use
Validate table structures before running dbt models
Apply data sensitivity guidelines for safe querying
limitations: Skill does not execute queries directly - provides guidance for bq CLI usage
Targeted at Monzo's BigQuery projects specifically
Does not handle authentication or credential management

use_cases.title: Explore table schemas
use_cases.description: Query column names, types, and table structures using safe INFORMATION_SCHEMA patterns.

use_cases.title: Validate source tables
use_cases.description: Verify table existence, row counts, and metadata before building data pipelines.

use_cases.title: Debug dbt models
use_cases.description: Investigate data issues by inspecting source table structures and column types.

prompt_templates.title: Check table schema
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the schema for table TABLE_NAME in dataset DATASET using INFORMATION_SCHEMA.

prompt_templates.title: Count table rows
prompt_templates.prompt: How many rows are in TABLE_NAME? Use a safe query that does not expose data.

prompt_templates.title: Find related tables
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all tables in dataset DATASET that contain 'customer' in the name.

prompt_templates.title: Validate dbt source
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if columns in my dbt source model match the actual BigQuery table schema.

output_examples.input: Show me the schema for transactions table in prod dataset

best_practices: Use INFORMATION_SCHEMA queries first to explore schemas without accessing actual data
Run COUNT(*) to check table size before running expensive queries
Apply dry-run flag for cost estimation on complex queries
anti_patterns: Querying actual rows from people, staff, or PII-containing tables
Running full table scans without checking row counts first
Omitting --project_id flag which can lead to wrong project queries

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The bq CLI must be installed locally.

faq.question: What are the BigQuery query limits?
faq.answer: Default query results are limited to 10GB of processed data per day. Use dry-run to estimate costs.

faq.question: How does this skill integrate with dbt?
faq.answer: This skill integrates with dbt by helping you inspect source table schemas before creating import models, verify source tables exist and have expected structure before running dbt, debug dbt failures by querying actual tables to understand data issues, and validate that column types match between source and generator models.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill promotes INFORMATION_SCHEMA queries that only return metadata, not actual data content.

faq.question: How does authentication work?
faq.answer: Authentication is handled by the installed bq CLI through gcloud SDK. The skill does not access credentials.

faq.question: How is this different from BigQuery console?
faq.answer: This skill provides CLI patterns for automation and scripting. The console offers visual query execution.
